PROCEDURE CODE
1212
The court may, at any stage of the proceedings and at the request of any party or of the notary-liquidator by a simple written request filed with or addressed to the court which appointed the notary-liquidator, appoint a manager to perform acts of administration and, where applicable, to represent the undivided co-owners in court.
The procedure continues in accordance with article 1211, ¤ 2, paragraphs 2 and 3. Once the time limit referred to in article 1211, ¤ 2, paragraph 3, has expired, the Registry summons the parties and the liquidating notary by judicial letter. If it grants the request, the court appoints an administrator, determines the scope of his duties and fixes his remuneration.
The administrator may be assisted by one or more persons acting under his or her responsibility.
